meeting_annotations.transcript: No and there are just so many there are just so many different examples and it really depends on your system. So so one thing that we have been thinking about is you know how you you can reprogram cells right so you have to reset chromatin structures chromatin modifications and so on but there's only a very small success probability of of that actually happening even if we start with a specific cell state. So we we've been thinking about and that's with some colleagues who have different expertise about how can you map out in time the cascades through which these cells go and which ones of them actually make it to the final state and then can we back propagate and and measure this kind of architecture of of that pathway in that sense I mean is it signaling I don't know but but so the one big thing there is we don't know the players we don't know what's going to change but at the same time it's also difficult to follow individual cells through that process. So so the idea that we have been putting forward it did not get funded but was to to put some sort of barcodes in the starting population so these barcodes get amplified so we can track daughter cells through the entire process and then find the barcodes that make it into the final sample and then backtrack and at every single time do these fishing experiments and see what is the population the distributions of states that we have at different time points and can we just construct the flow through this network of of states.
